title: (23600) Martos - 2F Calle Niño Jesús
description:
Large parking area with a long promenade with good views of the city and close to the old town so you can park and visit it on foot. There is also a recently built playground for the little ones. In winter it is usually quiet but in summer it is more crowded in the afternoons since people go up there to eat and hang out, taking advantage of the fact that due to its location there is usually a breeze and it is cooler than in the city. There are several food delivery establishments that have no problem delivering there, you just have to tell them that you are in the Paseo del Calvario parking lot. There is no sign restricting the use of motorhomes.

TO ACCESS YOU HAVE TO ENTER FROM THE HEALTH CENTER (C/Molino Medel) The other itineraries are too narrow

The village has a tourist information centre, museum, castle ruins and air raid shelter.
There is a fresh fruit and vegetable store and a small supermarket. There are also cafes and bars.
The village council are hoping to the facilities for stopping over available as soon as possible.

title: (23700) Linares - Calle Finca San José, 1

title: (23700) Linares - 17 Paseo Virgen de Linarejos
description: Very large underground parking. Beside the paseo and a laundromat. Apparently we can not sleep at night in Linares. But very convenient for a step.

title: (23740) Andújar - Carretera de la Estación, 13
description: Very nice place. Free electricity and water, but nice if you buy something from the store as a thank you. So we bought delicious olive oil and wine. The place is next to a grain silo. Open the gate yourself. Village is also very nice.

title: (23700) Linares - P Virgen de Linarejos
description:
Paved esplanade with a water utility pole under repair.
It is marked as temporary parking for motorhomes.
Near the city center, on the promenade.
very nice city with atmosphere.

title: (23700) Linares - 2 Calle del Río Guadalén
description: According to local police, you can only stay one day. City ​​with many interesting things to see a pity that the town council prohibits the parking of motorhomes.

title: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 544 Carretera de Córdoba
title_short: (23680) Alcalá la Real - 544 Carretera de Córdoba

title: (23747) Andújar - J-205
description: Repsol service station.

title: (23710) Bailén - Autovía del Sur
description: Rest area with gas station and cafeteria 24 hours, stop trucks

title: (18567) Domingo Pérez - Cam. Casa Nueva
description: Small shady spot (in the middle of the day) near a spring, with a bench for a picnic. Very quiet place below a hamlet. Please keep it clean: there is even a trash can, so there is no excuse for leaving your small papers and other waste on the floor!

title: (18560) Guadahortuna - 20 Calle Albaicin
description: Right next to a cemetery. very peaceful, no traffic at all. no services, no signs that parking is not allowed. perfect for a night. N.B. the asphalted area is a helicopter landing spot so take care to park on the grass or (if you have a small vehicle) right up close to the wall.

title: (14670) Valenzuela -
description: Picnic area near a chapel with barbecue and tables. The place is flat, there is some shade. The village is very close, there are bars and restaurants. We spent the night there, it is very quiet

title: (23710) Bailén - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area parking. Equipped with picnic areas and a water source (I don't know if it's drinkable)

title: (23430) Rus - 3 Calle Guadalimar
description: Area in the fairgrounds very quiet place with access to electricity

title: (23210) Guarromán - 32A Avenida Linares
description: Service station, which has an emptying area for motorhomes and motorhome parking. parking is for 3 motorhomes.

title: (23210) Guarromán - A-6100
description: Parking petrol station with small shop and self services. There’s a restaurant with self service and a Burger King. Allows dogs on the inside !

title: (23689) - Camino Olivares
description: Almazara au milieu de la nature, des activités touristiques et de l'expérience organoleptique. Vous pouvez obtenir de l'huile d'olive extra vierge de Jaén. Un charmant village où vous pourrez profiter des couchers de soleil de la subbética Cordoue et de la sierra méridionale de Jaén. La tranquillité est l'atmosphère qui règne ici. Des itinéraires sont disponibles à proximité pour faire du vélo et de la marche. Idéal pour aller avec des enfants.

title: (14859) Albendín - 26 Calle Noria
description: A new area with gray water and black water emptying point and clean water filling point very very cozy quiet town

title: (23430) Rus -
description: A little behind a road very little used. lake view. Very quiet at night, perfect before arriving in Ubeda (30min). There are other spots along this road. Accessible van but cc surely too. No service. please leave the place clean when you leave.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 7 Carretera Úbeda-Jaén
description: Wide set of parking lots, some dirt and others paved. It is a fairground (not currently used). It does not have services but it is quite quiet, although it is frequented by athletes and children during the day. We have met a van that has slept here for a few days and they have told us that the police do not say anything.

title: (23550) Cabra del Santo Cristo - 7 Parque Arturo Cerdá y Rico
title_short: (23550) Cabra del Santo Cristo - 7 Parque Arturo Cerdá y Rico
description: Quiet park at the entrance of the town with fountain

title: (14859) Albendín - Unnamed Road
description: On the dam about 8 parking spaces from the Naitic Club directly on the lake. We stayed here with 2 campers. Bar with great food available. It runs the 9km off the main road to get here. Class

name: Área de Autocaravanas Úbeda
title: (23400) Área de Autocaravanas Úbeda
description: Parking day and night. Very well maintained park with official permission to stay for maximum 48 hours with the usual restrictions on camping behavior. The rules clearly say no chairs or tables out. No cooking outside van. So please don’t!!  next door is an outdoor swimming pool. Great facilities. Lovely planting all around. 10 minute slow walk to the historic quarter. An UNESCO world heritage site teamed with Bezea 10 km away. There is a cycle path between the two. Great food and free tapas are common!

title: (23740) Andújar - Santuario Virgen de la Cabeza
title_short: (23740) Andújar - Santuario Virgen de la Cabeza
description: Place near restaurant / apartments Los Pintos. Between the pinas on the right. In addition to the ruins of a villa. Some remote traffic noise. Designated by Information Center. (Other locations in the area not allowed)

title: (23400) Úbeda - 84 Avenida de la Constitución
description:
Perfect parking day and night, close to the old center.
A little transient.

title: (23740) Jaén - Km.14 Santuario Virgen de la Cabeza

title: (23780) Lopera - 17 Calle Cuesta
description: Lopera is a small town in the province of Jaen and between the Castle and El Paseo you can park. It is a very quiet and beautiful town. Nearby you have bars where tapas and supermarkets where to buy. There are guided tours of its beautiful Castle and La Tercia. (((Wifi))). POINT WICO FREE WIFI ...

description: Parking in front of an Institute the area is quite quiet and next door you can eat the best churros in the whole province, they also make toast and snacks ...

description: Laundromat.

description: Central car park, 50 spaces, the entrance is level but very narrow and very quiet.

title: (23748) Andújar - A-6177

title: (23400) Úbeda - 12 Calle Redonda de Miradores

title: (23400) Úbeda - 3 Calle Andalucía
description: To equip yourself with a Spanish propane gas bottle and regulator instead of a French one. Existing lyre and filter used such as. Quality help from the agency manager!

title: (18550) Iznalloz - 69D Barrio la Nava
description: Free water and air

title: (14880) Luque - CO-6204
description:
Parking actually for the excursion point
"Laguna del Salobral.
However, the lagoon has completely dried up. so it is rarely visited.
A very very quiet place.
In the midst of olive plantations.
No problems.

The place is right on the bike path
"Via Verde del Aceite"
This bike path is an open railway line. (olive oil train). In this area it runs through a very beautiful part of Andalusia. Over bridges and small gorges, almost flat.
Ideal for small bike tours.

title: (23210) Guarromán - 285 Autovía del Sur
description: Rest area, gas station galp, with table to eat, drinking water source. It is next to the A4 motorway, heading south, the only drawback vehicles continually pass by.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: (PRÓXIMA APERTURA) Área para autocaravanas, caravanas y camper. Contamos con zona de vaciado y llenado, aseos, puntos de luz, lavadero y lavandería.

title: (18249) Tózar - 2 Calle Nueva ag Tozar
description:
Level place/parking in rural village. Quiet to spent a night. Bakery comes in a van in the (late) morning (beeps).
Access very easy with any camper size. Other options also available around the village.
Free water tap with connector available on site, behind the building.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina - 3 Calle Donantes de Sangre
title_short: (23711) Baños de la Encina - 3 Calle Donantes de Sangre
description: Small pitch on ground, slightly sloping, next to a park with swings. If there are no other cars parked, two motorhomes enter. Good views of the city and the wall. Without any service (water, electricity ..), only parking.

title: (23740) Andújar -
description: Cute picnic area next to the chapel and there are a few ruins. In the middle of nature, very calm, we spent a night there without problem. Lots of room but the ground is not very flat, we found a place at the top of the hill. Correct route to reach it.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - Autovía del Sur
description: Ok parking for a night or two. Concreet ground very level.

title: (23400) Úbeda - 30 Calle Risquillo Bajo
description: Self-service laundry.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: Small forest parking lot with a nice view of the castle and the forest. spent a very quiet night here. Not suitable for very large mobile homes. We have a T4. No services. Some rubbish all around so please take your rubbish with you. Thanks

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: Great, largely shady place on the edge of the forest right on the reservoir. Depending on the water level, it is a few meters down to the shore, when the water level is full you are almost right on the water. In the morning completely shaded by the trees, during the day there are also sunny spots to sit or lie down. Fantastic nature that is rarely found in the area. The access is recommended via the upper of the two paths and is very bumpy with larger rocks, but also possible without a 4x4.

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina - Unnamed Road
title_short: (23711) Baños de la Encina - Unnamed Road
description: 5 minutes from the small village Baños de la encina, flat place overlooking the lake with incredible views.

title: (23210) Guarromán - Ronda Urbana Norte
description: Motorway rest area with filling and emptying area. In the Cordoba - Albacete direction, on the A4 motorway, the gps takes exit 286 and takes a dirt road for about 2.5 km, it is better to exit at 283, the station is on the other on the motorway side, the area is at the back on the right. Good for the services.

title: (23700) Linares - A-312
description: Parking of the Natural Monument "El Piélago"

title: (14812) Almedinilla - 33 Paseo Alameda
description: Information Point Parking to see the incredible ruins of El Ruedo, a Roman villa from the 1st century AD.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - 20 Paseo de la Libertad
description: Ample level paved parking with the possibility of spending the night quietly (as long as it is not a market) next to Paseo de la Libertad. It has no services of any kind.

title: (14812) Almedinilla - 1E Paseo Moreras
description: Site to leave without problems and spend the night. It is next to a park in general you have everything and it is a town with a lot of history it is recommended to go to the tourist office and ask for information

title: (14812) Almedinilla - Calle Media Era, 1
description: Quiet and quite flat street, next to a gym park and soccer field. Near the municipal pool, ideal in summer. Without services. Perfect to visit Almedinilla and close to shops and bars that serve you free tapas. Almedinilla is beautiful, with fountains, flower patios and pretty trails. Its Iberian settlement, the Roman villa and the waterfall of the horse jumping to Fuente Grande is a must visit. We have spent three days here and great. It is a quiet and safe town.

title: (18568) Píñar - 52 Calle Real
description: Parking lot next to the main street of the city. Easy access, unpaved ground, space for 3 vehicles. Quiet area with no services ideal for visiting the village and the cave of the windows

title: (23210) Guarromán - 11 Calle Santa Mª de la Cabeza
title_short: (23210) Guarromán - 11 Calle Santa Mª de la Cabeza
description: Small very quiet parking lot in the town and close to the highway. We stop to rest but you can spend the night surely without problem

address.street: 11 Calle Santa Mª de la Cabeza

title: (23748) Andújar - A-6177
description: Quiet corner by the water, turtles, crayfish and shade, van only! Forbidden to stay overnight

description: Quiet place, in flat

title: (23748) Andújar - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place to picnic

title: (18247) Moclín - 8A Calle Mota
description: Passage in the narrow village

title: (23748) Andújar - Unnamed Road
description: Very pretty place to make a campfire. There is a lot of place to park but not much space to park the car straight for the night... in this area you can spot Iberian lynxes and otters.

title: (18247) Moclín - 71 Calle Real
description: Place to park and spend the night, without services, uneven but spacious and quiet, crowded on weekends as a parking lot for hikers.

title: (18247) Moclín - 5 Carretera de Tiena
description: Parking by the side of a quiet road on the edge of the village. Stunning view across the plain towards the rising sun. From here you can visit the castle and also make the route of the PR A-84, called Ruta del Gollizno (derived from "gollizo": narrowness of a place).

title: (23210) Los Ríos - 4 A-4
description: Service area, Repsol gas station, showers, 24-hour restaurant, parking to park with the car.

title: (18247) Moclín - 8 Calle Hacho
description: Parking area in Moclín next to a public park, hermitage and the Post Office. There is no traffic as it is a dead end street. Allows maneuvering without difficulty.

title: (18247) Moclín - 16 Calle Hacho
description: Quiet parking, next to sports courts, beautiful views, level, without services

title: (23210) Los Ríos - 520 JV-5043
description: Motorway services westbound. Shade trees. Far enough from motorway to avoid major road noise. Fine for an overnight or somewhere shaded to stop for lunch

title: (18248) Moclín - 8 Calle Cerro Alto
description: Perfect parking area to start the Gollizno route. It is not the official start, but being circular, it does not matter. Only three km from the bridges. The last climb is somewhat narrow, but the open field has room to maneuver. Nearby there is a good children's park (uphill street).

title: (18248) Olivares - Unnamed Road
description: It costs to get there but very well, nearby picnic areas, without services.

title: (18248) Olivares - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area a bit abandoned. Access is via a road in very poor condition and with a steep slope. It has tables and a water fountain. For Campers that are not very low (not for motorhomes). We stayed one night and did the Gollizno route and visited Moclin.

title: (23748) Casas de El Encinarejo -
description: Quiet and beautiful place near the lake. Trash containers nearby, public toilet, beach, public tables and grill spots.

title: (23211) Carboneros - Camino de Valdeinfierno al Madroñal
title_short: (23211) Carboneros - Camino de Valdeinfierno al Madroñal
description: Parking dam, great view, very quiet !!

title: (18248) Tiena - GR-3408
description: Small picnic area with 3 tables. we spent a quiet night there, without car noise in the evening despite the nearby road. there is space for a motorhome. Magnificent view with the sunset.

title: (23748) Andújar - A-6177
description: Recreational area of "El Jabalí". Area a few kilometers from the sanctuary of the Virgen de la Cabeza. In the middle of Sierra Morena. Shaded areas, no water, with bins.

title: (23220) Vilches - JH-6081
description: Haven of peace at the edge of the water reservoir of the dam. Quiet night except perhaps on weekends. Complicated access road for large motorhomes. No service outside the trash.

title: (18570) Deifontes - GR-3423
description: A nice quiet place to stay. Also water awailable.
